channel.title: Who would you rather be President (Choose Anyone)
channel.description:
Offer who you'd rather have to be president of the united states government. There's two rules: 1. Take it at least somewhat seriously. 2. Romney and Obama need to be left out as choices since obv. they are in the elections. This is about people who you'd rather be in the election right now.
Why do you feel this person should be president and what do you think this person would do if president. I will list who i feel are winners in a poll i will post afterwards.
My choice? I feel that Gary Johnson would be a generic choice. I just want a 3rd party candidate I loved the way he ran things in new mexico (i lived in Taos and Roswell while he was governor).

item.description:
@jme wrote:

m1lkman:

I don’t know why I am having trouble comprehending Bowser’s comment. Been hit in the head too many times

It’s ok, he sucks at english lol. I’ve noticed a remarkable improvement over the years though (good for u bowser, most of us can’t speak more than one language)

Ecko:

Iran’s state news reported a fake story from The Onion that a majority of Americans would rather have Ahmedinejad as POTUS over Obama. For some reason I think that may be true.

Lol. Maybe that will ease some tensions Iran news should use the onion more

item.title: Who would you rather be President (Choose Anyone)
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Theodore Roosevelt or George Washington if we could pick anyone. If someone present I would like someone as bowser said. A revolutionary who isn’t pressuredby the large companies. And maybe somehow get rid of lobbying (highly doubt that will happen any time soon)? I’m quite young in the field of politics so I can’t particularly point out a particular candidate, but I’m betting I’d like this Castro guy. going to read up on him when I get home. tis a shame that he isn’t born in America.

Read full topic

item.title: Who would you rather be President (Choose Anyone)
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:39, topic:455194”]Niall: It is all about what sign we are sending to the “Muslim world”. I know that it won’t disappear completely, but we are at least telling them that we agree with it crossing the line.

You don’t refuse to move at the street when a wolf riding an elephant is heading towards you. You might have the law on your side, but that doesn’t matter when you’re dead. People should know it by now, Muslims doesn’t like it when people are ridiculing their prophet.[/quote]

And Christians don’t like it when people make fun of Jesus.[quote=“Niall, post:36, topic:455194”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=558097.msg4104639#msg4104639 date=1347834064]There are anti-american protests in a (supposedly) american-friendly country. Not to mention they attacked the US Embassy.[/quote]

“they” attacked a us embassy? who are “they”? of course, this is ignoring reports that those attacks were in the planning before the film was uploaded to youtube

it may seem like a trivial distinction but I do not think it is trivial, reports of the protest are referred to problems in the “muslim world” as if all muslims were responsible and when people try to counter this by “but if the moderate muslims are standing idly by while extremists kill innocent people, then all muslims are guilty” I find such a counter argument bollocks, are you as a christian responsible for anders breiviks attack? are you as a white person responsible for anders breiviks attack?

Doesn’t matter anyways. Our pussy ass government gave in to the muslim brotherhood and took the video down - unconstitutional btw. Obviously not happy about this situation, Obama is being a bitch about the whole thing.

the film is still on youtube, as far as I’m aware only a few mainly islamic countries have blocked it[/quote]

I thought the government had blocked it. What I heard was a bunch of media companies screaming for the taking down of the video. My mistake.

“They” = Libyan and Egyptian Muslim protesters

Read full topic

You don’t refuse to move at the street when a wolf riding an elephant is heading towards you. You might have the law on your side, but that doesn’t matter when you’re dead. People should know it by now, Muslims doesn’t like it when people are ridiculing their prophet.

item.title: Who would you rather be President (Choose Anyone)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I have mixed feelings. I’m fine with the video for the same reason I’d be fine with a video against Christians, homosexuals, black people, white people, Europeans etc. being up. I’m fine with the video being up because I’m not one who thinks Muslims should be treated with kiddie gloves. On the other hand there has been some clear tension with some members of the Muslim world in the past decade which makes me think this video is in bad taste and does nothing but to incite violence and riots. That’s not to say I’m against free speech about any topics regarding Muslims, but there’s a clear line between having arguments and criticism against Islam, and films with no clear purpose other than to provoke a group when tensions are already high.

At the end of the day though, riots and protests are already happening and regardless or not if the film is removed, thanks to copycat behaviour I doubt the riots or protests will subside any quicker.

Read full topic
item.source: Who would you rather be President (Choose Anyone)

item.title: Who would you rather be President (Choose Anyone)
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Yes, Youtube refuse to remove it. But a long Islam critical sideshow with music they removed (ABBs Youtube movie).

YT is just trying to score some cheap points here. They cannot claim they stand for freedom of speech, as countless examples in the past shown a less free speech friendly practise.

I don’t know if you guys would agree, but that film should get removed. It is not criticism but slander. You cannot claim that Muslims do not distance itself from the film either. The biggest Muslim organisation in Norway: Islam Net, do oppose any demonstration. Their reasoning is that the film’s intent is trick Muslims into a violent response.

Read full topic

it may seem like a trivial distinction but I do not think it is trivial, reports of the protest are referred to problems in the “muslim world” as if all muslims were responsible and when people try to counter this by “but if the moderate muslims are standing idly by while extremists kill innocent people, then all muslims are guilty” I find such a counter argument bollocks, are you as a christian responsible for anders breiviks attack? are you as a white person responsible for anders breiviks attack?
